meanings.definition: To a greater extent or degree
meanings.sent1: She wanted to further her education by attending college.
meanings.sent2: He decided to further explore the forest to find more animals.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to further its collection of acorns but kept dropping them.
meanings.sent4: His determination to further his career was like a strong wind pushing him forward.
meanings.sent5: The sun's rays further illuminated the room, revealing hidden details.

meanings.sent1: She was tired; further, she had a headache.
meanings.sent2: The book was interesting; further, it had beautiful illustrations.
meanings.sent3: He ate the cake; further, he drank a glass of milk.
meanings.sent4: The music was loud; further, it was out of tune.
meanings.sent5: The movie was funny; further, it had a touching ending.

meanings.definition: To help the progress or development of something
meanings.sent1: The teacher wanted to further the students' understanding of math.
meanings.sent2: She volunteered to further the community garden by planting more flowers.
meanings.sent3: The chef added spices to further enhance the flavor of the dish.
meanings.sent4: His encouragement further motivated his team to achieve their goals.
meanings.sent5: The rain helped further the growth of the crops in the field.

meanings.definition: To a greater distance or extent
meanings.sent1: He decided to further explore the unknown territory beyond the mountains.
meanings.sent2: The road sign indicated that the gas station was further down the highway.
meanings.sent3: The cat chased the mouse further into the garden but couldn't catch it.
meanings.sent4: The river flowed further into the valley, creating a beautiful landscape.
meanings.sent5: The hikers continued further up the trail to reach the mountain peak.
